trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of coffee on brain activity and cognition
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The acute effects of coffee on brain activity and cognitive function in a healthy older population

interventions.interventions: Participants receive four types of instant coffee beverages with varying levels of caffeine over four study visits separated by at least a one week washout period. One coffee beverage is administered per study visit, in a within-subject, crossover study design. Each beverage contains 6g coffee dissolved in 300ml boiling water with milk if desired.
interventions.comparator: Placebo drink (6g maltodextrin with coffee flavour)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Sustained attention via the Rapid Visual Information Processing task. Accuaracy, reaction time and evoked response potential (ERP) components will be measured.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline and post-treatment on four separate occasions (visit 1,2,3 and 4)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Immediate and delayed recall and delayed recognition on the visual verbal learning test
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline and post-treatment on four separate occasions (visit 1,2,3 and 4)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Emotion face processing accuracy, reaction time and evoked response potential (ERP) components via a computerised facial expression recognition task.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline and post-treatment on four separate occasions (visit 1,2,3 and 4)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Inspection time on the Inspection time task
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline and post-treatment on four separate occasions (visit 1,2,3 and 4)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Stroop interference via the Stroop Colour-Word Test, a pen and paper neuropsychological task.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline and post-treatment on four separate occasions (visit 1,2,3 and 4)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Subjective mood (Bond and Lader visual analogue scale and Caffeine Research visual anlogue scale)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline and post-treatment on four separate occasions (visit 1,2,3 and 4)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Mis-match negativity evoked response potential (ERP) to auditory stimuli
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at baseline and post-treatment on four separate occasions (visit 1,2,3 and 4)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Aged 50 and over Medically and psychiatrically healthy Light to moderate coffee drinkers Written informed consent obtained
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Clinically high blood pressure Smoker Currently taking psychotropic medications Allergy to lactose, gluten or wheat Hearing impairment

trial_design.concealment: The order of treatment was randomly assigned to the subject by a central randomisation table created off-site

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study is being conducted to see the effects of various coffee beverages on cognitive function, brain activity and mood in healthy older adults. The study will compare the effect of different types of instant coffee beverages. We will measure brain activity and performance on different cognitive and computer tasks before and after four different coffee beverages.
